cast.title: Alias John Preston
cast.overview: A mysterious young man settles in a rural English town and immediately starts making a good impression. Before long he has insinuated himself into local life, is married and is serving on the board of the local hospital. Everything seems to be going well for him until a newly appointed consultant psychiatrist shows up and starts asking some probing questions.

cast.title: It Always Rains on Sunday
cast.overview: Robert Hamer's bleak portrait of life in London's East End.

cast.title: Escape
cast.overview: Escape is a thriller about a World War II vet who goes to prison for murder and then escapes. He meets a woman who tries to get him to surrender.

cast.title: Cosh Boy
cast.overview: Retitled The Slasher in the US. The gruesome story of a violent man who finally goes too far.

cast.title: Murder by Proxy
cast.overview: When a beautiful girl offers Casey Morrow a lot of money for a mystery job, Morrow doesn't ask too many questions. But when the girl's father is found murdered the following day and Morrow's coat is soaked with blood perhaps a little more caution should have been exercised. An intriguing story of deception, greed and immorality.

cast.title: The History of Mr. Polly
cast.overview: Quiet and somewhat direction-less, Alfred Polly uses the money he inherits from his father to marry and to set up shop in a small town. His heart is in neither of these enterprises and he eventually resorts to desperate measures to break free. His random wanderings in the countryside lead him to a new opportunity that just might be what he's been looking for all along.

cast.title: Grand National Night
cast.overview: The story of a husband's implication in his wife's death, his stupid disposal of her body and the police enquiry which almost embroils him in a murder charge.

cast.title: Death At Broadcasting House
cast.overview: An actor is murdered live on air whilst a play is being broadcast.  Everyone in the play and broadcasting house fall under suspicion.

cast.title: Now Barabbas
cast.overview: 1949 British drama film based on a play by William Douglas-Home.

cast.title: The Man in Black
cast.overview: Henry Clavering suspects his second wife Bertha is trying to drive his daughter (by his first marriage) insane, to stop her inheriting his money. He decides to use his yoga skills to pretend to be dead, and thereby expose her villainy.

cast.title: Play Up the Band
cast.overview: A brass band goes to London to take part in a competition.

cast.title: Tropical Trouble
cast.overview: A series of misunderstanding leads to a colonial governor's wife suspecting him of an affair with his assistant.

cast.title: The Passionate Friends
cast.overview: The passionate friends were in love when young, but separated, and she married an older man. Then Mary Justin meets Steven Stratton again and they have one last fling together in the Alps.

cast.title: My Old Duchess
cast.overview: An actor impersonates a duchess â€“ with truly astonishing results for him and his company!

cast.title: Excuse My Glove
cast.overview: A young man, whose main interest in life is stained glass, accidentally accepts a challenge to fight in a fair boxing booth.

cast.title: Joy Ride
cast.overview: Two cousins invite their girlfriends on a joy-ride, but car trouble leads to catastrophe!

cast.title: Radio Lover
cast.overview: A penniless young charmer hits upon an ingenious route to fame and fortune.

cast.title: Children Galore
cast.overview: As a going away gift to a small village, the local Lord and Lady promise a new cottage to the local couple with the most grandchildren. Competitive instincts and petty jealousies ensue.

cast.title: Chick
cast.overview: The hall porter at an Oxbridge College inherits an Earldom and enjoys a series of adventures.

cast.title: Under a Cloud
cast.overview: Jimmy Forbes returns to England after being on the run in Australia for 20 years. He finds that his wife has gone up in the world and become wealthy. Their children know little about him but as he observes them he realises they have problems and his cunning might come to their aid.

cast.title: Meet Me Tonight
cast.overview: Meet Me Tonight was the American title for the British-filmed Tonight at 8:30, adapted from the Noel Coward stage production of the same name.

cast.title: Trio
cast.overview: W. Somerset Maugham introduces three more of his stories about human foibles.

cast.title: The Belles of St. Trinian's
cast.overview: Story of manic schoolgirls who are more interested in racing form than books as they try to get-rich-quick, aided by the head-mistress' brother, played by Alastair Sim, who also plays the head-mistress.
